title: Linked Data in Linguistics for NLP and Web Annotation

author: Sebastian Hellmann, Department of Business Information Systems, University of Leipzig

segmentation: My name is Sebastian Hellmann.
Um, I'm researcher at HSW, University of Lactic and I'm also working on the LD2U project.

Get into the gardens.
End.
What I will talk about today is turning walled gardens into park networks of semantic linguistic data.
So the basic question is, how can we leverage the data web or natural language processing?

The oneness of the Working Group for open linguistics data, which is not.

Of the linguistic linked open data Cloud, we started this as working group at the Open Knowledge Foundation and soon we there was a great resonance and suddenly the group now consists of maybe 50 researchers which all tried to 1st published the data under open licenses and then also convert and interconvert the data object and interlinked with other knowledge, more sources.
So this network here is growing in a decentralized fashion.
Everybody contributes a little bit.
And in the end it kind of interconnects with itself.

'cause it's hardly possible to find individualised institutions in a way 'cause if one institution takes more work or more credit, it takes away the incentive for other researchers to also contribute.

And this is one of my favorite antipatterns.
It's called the Golden hammer antipattern.
Normally it means if company or institution or community.
They invent a certain thing or technology for certain use case, and then they get kind of like blind and don't see anything else anymore.
And they just think this technology is.
Perfect, we don't need anything else.
